entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 11:09AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Water Levels on Interior Rivers... Temperatures warming into the 70`s through next week will result in increased snowmelt runoff from higher elevations. This will bring rising water levels to Interior rivers that still have a significant snowpack in their headwaters. This includes rivers draining the Alaska Range and the Tanana-Yukon Uplands. Water

entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations 10 to 20 inches above 8000 feet, with higher amounts possible, greatest on north and east facing slopes. * WHERE...In Montana, Pryor/Northern Bighorn Mountains. In Wyoming, Northeast Bighorn Mountains.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 29 at 3:43PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Runoff has begun, with significant rises on area streams... Warmer temperatures last week increased mountain snowmelt, resulting in significant rises on area streams. The addition of significant precipitation through Tuesday will add more runoff to these waterways.
